                                                      Quantum State

                                                      Bloch Sphere

                                                      |ψ⟩=α|0⟩+β|1⟩‖α‖2+‖β‖2=1=cos(θ/2)|0⟩+eiϕsin(θ/2)|1⟩=cos(θ/2)|0⟩+(cosϕ+i sinϕ)sin(θ/2)|1⟩

                                                       

                                                      • z axis : |0⟩=[10]|1⟩=[01]

                                                      • x axis : |+⟩=12[11]|−⟩=12[1−1]

                                                      • y axis : |+⟩y=12[1i]|−⟩y=12[1−i]

                                                        pauli matrices : σ^x=[0110]σ^y=[0−ii0]σ^z=[100−1]

                                                      No-cloning theorem

                                                      ∄U^ ∀ψ,ϕU(|ψ⟩⊗|0⟩)=|ψ⟩⊗|ψ⟩U(|ϕ⟩⊗|0⟩)=|ϕ⟩⊗|ϕ⟩

                                                      Entanglement

                                                      |Ψ⟩AB≠|α⟩A⊗|β⟩B

                                                      • Bell states : maximally entangled states for two qubits

                                                      |Φ+⟩=12(|00⟩+|11⟩)|Ψ+⟩=12(|01⟩+|10⟩)|Φ−⟩=12(|00⟩−|11⟩)|Ψ−⟩=12(|01⟩−|10⟩)

                                                      • identify entanglement : more than 1 non-zero eigen values ∃λ1,λ2≠0

                                                      • product state : |Ψ⟩AB=|α⟩A⊗|β⟩B no entanglement

                                                      • Schmidt decomposition : |Ψ⟩∈H1⊗H2→|Ψ⟩=∑i=1mλi|ui⟩⊗|vi⟩|ui⟩∈H1,|vi⟩∈H2

                                                        • Schmidt rank : m

                                                        • Schmidt coefficient : αi

                                                          Example

                                                          Ψ=|00⟩+|11⟩+2|++⟩10=3|00⟩+2|01⟩+2|10⟩+3|11⟩10

                                                          schmidt rank : 4

                                                          schmidt coefficient : 110[3,2,2,3]

                                                      Bell Inequality

                                                      Quantum Gate

                                                       

                                                      Rotation

                                                      • Rx(θ)=e−iθX/2=cos(θ/2)I−i sin(θ/2)X=[cos(θ/2)−i sin(θ/2)−i sin(θ/2)cos(θ/2)]

                                                      • Ry(θ)=e−iθY/2=cos(θ/2)I−i sin(θ/2)Y=[cos(θ/2)− sin(θ/2)sin(θ/2)cos(θ/2)]

                                                      • Rz(θ)=e−iθZ/2=cos(θ/2)I−i sin(θ/2)Z=[e−iθ/200eiθ/2]

                                                      Pauli Gates

                                                      σ{x,y,z} rotate around {x,y,z} axis by π in Bloch sphere

                                                      Hadamard Gate

                                                      H rotation about axis 12(x^+z^) by π

                                                      • H|0⟩=12(|0⟩+|1⟩)=|+⟩

                                                      • H|1⟩=12(|0⟩−|1⟩)=|−⟩

                                                      • H|x⟩=12(|0⟩+(−1)x|1⟩)

                                                      • H⊗n|x⟩=12n∑y∈{0,1}n(−1)x⋅y|y⟩

                                                      Two qubits Gate

                                                      • CNOT=|0⟩c⟨0|c⊗I^t+|1⟩c⟨1|c⊗X^t

                                                      • CPAHSE=|0⟩c⟨0|c⊗I^t+|1⟩c⟨1|c⊗Z^t

                                                      Matrix Table

                                                      Universal quantum gates

                                                      • Rotation gates Rx(θ),Ry(θ),Rz(θ), phase gate P(ϕ), CNOT

                                                      • Cliffor set {CNOT, H, S} , T

                                                      • Toffoli gate, Hadamard gate

                                                      Clifford group : Cn={U∈U(2n:∀P∈Pn:UPU−1∈Pn}

                                                      Algorithms

                                                      Complexity

                                                      • BPP⊂BQP : quantum simulation of classical circuits

                                                      Oracle

                                                      • Phase oracle : Uf|x⟩=(−1)f(x)|x⟩

                                                        Of|y⟩|x⟩=|y⊕f(x)⟩|x⟩Of|−⟩|x⟩=Of12(|0⟩−|1⟩)|x⟩=12(|f(x)⟩−|1⊕f(x)⟩)|x⟩=(−1)f(x)|−⟩|x⟩

                                                      • Bit oracle : Of|y⟩|x⟩=|y⊕f(x)⟩|x⟩

                                                      Deutsch-Josza

                                                      Distinguish f(x) whether is constant function or balanced function. O(N)→O(1)

                                                      • constant: evaluates to the same value regardless of input

                                                      • balanced: the number of inputs which output 1 equals the number of inputs which output 0

                                                      ⟨0|⊗nH⊗nUfH⊗n|0⟩⊗n=⟨0|⊗nH⊗nUf(12n∑x∈{0,1}n|x⟩)⏟H⊗n|0⟩⊗n=⟨0|⊗nH⊗n(12n∑x∈{0,1}n(−1)f(x)|x⟩)=⟨0|⊗n12n∑x∈{0,1}n(−1)f(x)(12n∑y∈{0,1}n(−1)x⋅y|y⟩)=12n∑x,y∈{0,1}n(−1)f(x)(−1)x⋅y⟨0⊗n|y⟩=12n∑x∈{0,1}n(−1)f(x)={0f(x) is balanced±1f(x) is constant

                                                      Notation :

                                                      1. n : length of bit string

                                                      2. N : total number of quantum state N=2n

                                                      3. H : Hadamard gate

                                                      Grover

                                                      find the unique x0 that f(x0)=1, O(N)→O(N)

                                                      • oracle operator : Uf=I−2|x0⟩⟨x0|U0=I−2|0⟩⊗n⟨0|⊗n

                                                      • grover diffusion : Us=H⊗n(−U0)H⊗n=2|+n⟩⟨+n|−I

                                                      Reflection

                                                      • Reflection about |ψ⊥⟩: Rψ⊥|ϕ⟩=(I−2|ψ⟩⟨ψ|) (α|ψ⟩+β|ψ⊥⟩)=−α|ψ⟩+β|ψ⊥⟩

                                                        • Uf=Rx0⊥ reflect about |x0⊥⟩

                                                      • Reflection about |ψ⟩ : Rψ|ϕ⟩=(2|ψ⟩⟨ψ|−I) (α|ψ⟩+β|ψ⊥⟩)=α|ψ⟩−β|ψ⊥⟩

                                                        • Us=R+ : reflection about |+n⟩

                                                      ⟨x0|UsUf|ϕ⟩=cos(arccos(⟨x0|ϕ⟩)−2arcsin(⟨x0|+⟩))⟨x0|(UsUf)r|+n⟩=cos(arccos(⟨x0|+⟩)−2r arcsin(⟨x0|+⟩))
                                                      ⇒r=arccos(1N)2 arcsin(1N)≈πN4

                                                      Algorithm

                                                      1. |Ψ⟩←H⊗n|0⟩⊗n : after this step |Ψ⟩=|+n⟩

                                                      2. for r times, r=artcos(1N)2arcsin(1N)

                                                        1. |Ψ⟩←UsUf|Ψ⟩

                                                      3. measure |Ψ⟩, the greatest probability will be x0

                                                      Notation

                                                      • n : length of bit string

                                                      • N : total number of quantum state N=2n

                                                      • |+n⟩=12n∑x={0,1}n|x⟩=1N∑x={0,1}n|x⟩

                                                       

                                                      [QFT] Quantum Fourier transform

                                                      QN|x⟩=1N∑y=0N−1e2πixy/N|y⟩ : O(NlogN)→O(n2)

                                                      QN|x⟩=1N∑y∈{0,1}ne2πixy/N|y⟩=1N∑y∈{0,1}ne2πix∑kn2kyk/N|yn−1⟩⋯|y0⟩⏟single bits of e2πixy/N=1N⊗j=1n(∑yn−j∈{0,1}e2πixyn−j/2j|yn−j⟩)=1N(|0n−1⟩+e.x02πi|1n−1⟩)⊗(|0n−2⟩+e.x1x02πi|1n−2⟩)⋯(|00⟩+e.xn−1⋯x02πi|10⟩)=1N(H|x0⟩)⊗(R1H|x1⟩)…(Rn−1…R1H|xn−1⟩)

                                                      Number of gates in QFT of n bit string

                                                      • CRj (Controled-Rj) : n(n−1)2

                                                      • SWAP : n2 used to reverse the qubit

                                                      • H : n

                                                      Notation

                                                      • n : length of bit string

                                                      • N : total number of quantum state N=2n

                                                      • Rd : rotation matrix : Rd=[100e2πi/2d+1]

                                                      • H : Hadamard gate : H=12[111−1] H|xk⟩=12(|0⟩+e.xk2πi|1⟩)

                                                      • e.x1x0 : e12x1+14x0

                                                      Example

                                                      Q2=12[111−1]=HQ3=13[1111e2πi/3e−2πi/31e−2πi/3e2πi/3]Q4=12[11111i−1−i1−11−11−i−1i]

                                                       

                                                      Shor factoring

                                                      given a non-prime integer N represented as a bit string, find a non-trivial factor axmod N, armodN=1→(ar/2+1)(ar/2−1)modN=0

                                                      |Φ⟩=Of(id⊗n⊗H⊗n)|0⟩⊗n|0⟩⊗n=Of1N∑x∈{0,1}n|0⟩⊗n|x⟩=1N∑x∈{0,1}n|f(x)⟩|x⟩|Ψz⟩=rN∑t=0N/r−1|x0+rt⟩∝∑x:f(x)=z|x⟩|Ψ~z⟩=QN†|Ψz⟩=rN2∑t=0N/r−1∑y=0N−1e−2πi(x0+rt)y/N|y⟩=rN2∑y=0,rymod=0N−1e−2πix0y/NNr|y⟩=1r∑y=0,rymod=0N−1e−2πix0y/N|y⟩

                                                      Algorithm

                                                      1. find the order r that ax mod N=ax+r mod N using period finding in O(poly(n))

                                                        1. |Ψ⟩=I⊗n⊗H⊗n|0⟩⊗n⊗|0⟩⊗n=|0⟩⊗n⊗(1N∑x∈{0,1}|x⟩)

                                                        2. |Φ⟩=Of|Ψ⟩=1N∑x∈{0,1}|f(x)⟩|x⟩

                                                        3. measure f(x)=z then |Ψz⟩=rN∑t=0N/r−1|x0+rt⟩∝∑x:f(x)=z|x⟩

                                                        4. |Φ⟩~=QN†|Ψ⟩z=rN2∑t=0N/r−1∑y=0N−1e−2πi(x0+rt)y/N|y⟩=1r∑y=0,rymodN=0N−1e−2πix0y/N|y⟩

                                                        5. measure |Φ⟩~ multiple times s1,⋯,si, the results are multiples of r, use euclid algorithm to compute the r=N/gcd(s1,⋯,si)

                                                      2. if r mod 2=0 and ar/2±1 mod N≠0

                                                        1. candidate factor p~=gcd(ar/2−1,N) using euclid algorithm

                                                      3. else go to 1

                                                      ​x
                                                      1
                                                      @classical
                                                      2
                                                      def euclid_gcd(a, b):
                                                      3
                                                          # O(logn)
                                                      4
                                                          return b if a==0 else euclid_gcd(b%a, a)
                                                      5
                                                      @quantum
                                                      6
                                                      def period_finding(a, n, N):
                                                      7
                                                          # a^r mod N = 1, O(N)
                                                      8
                                                          Of = lambda x: a**x % N
                                                      9
                                                          s0, s1 = None, None
                                                      10
                                                          while True:
                                                      11
                                                              x0, x1 = zeros(n), zeros(n)
                                                      12
                                                              x0, x1 = I(x0), H(x1)
                                                      13
                                                              x0, x1 = Of(x0, x1)
                                                      14
                                                              if not measure(x0).all_equals(): # O(2^n/n) = O(N/n) fail
                                                      15
                                                                  continue
                                                      16
                                                              x1 = IQFT(x1)
                                                      17
                                                              if s0 is None:  # fail O(1)
                                                      18
                                                                  s0 = measure(x1)
                                                      19
                                                                  continue
                                                      20
                                                              s1 = measure(x1)
                                                      21
                                                              N_r= euclid_gcd(s0, s1) # N/r if k coprime k'
                                                      22
                                                              s0, s1 = None, None
                                                      23
                                                              r = N / N_r
                                                      24
                                                              break
                                                      25
                                                              
                                                      26
                                                          return r
                                                      27
                                                      

                                                      28
                                                      def shor_factoring(N):
                                                      29
                                                          # find a factor of N
                                                      30
                                                          n = ceil(log2(N))
                                                      31
                                                          
                                                      32
                                                          while True:
                                                      33
                                                              a = random(N)
                                                      34
                                                              K = euclid_gcd(a, N):
                                                      35
                                                              if K != 1:
                                                      36
                                                                  return K 
                                                      37
                                                        
                                                      38
                                                              r = period_finding(a, n, N)
                                                      39
                                                              if is_odd(r): continue 
                                                      40
                                                              g = eulid_gcd(N, a**(r//2 + 1))
                                                      41
                                                              if g != 1: 
                                                      42
                                                                  return g

                                                       

                                                      Error Correction

                                                      Quantum operations

                                                      • Density operator : ρ^=∑i,jρi,j|i⟩⟨j|

                                                        • diagonal gives the probability of the state

                                                      • Partial trace : TrB(|a1⟩⟨a2|⊗|b1⟩⟨b2|)=|a1⟩⟨a2|Tr(|b1⟩⟨b2|)

                                                      • Purification : ρA=TrR(|AR⟩⟨AR|)

                                                      • Evolution : ρt=Uρ0U†

                                                      • Trace Preserving CP map : ρ(t)=τA(ρA(0))

                                                        • trace preserving : Tr(ρ)=1

                                                        • positive : λρ≥0

                                                        • complete positivity

                                                      • Kraus Operator : ρ′=∑iE^iρ0E^i†E^i=⟨ei|U^|e0⟩

                                                      Damping channel

                                                      • Amplitude Dampling ：E^1=[0γ00]E^0=[1001−γ]

                                                        • excited state |1⟩ damping to |0⟩ due to loss of energy

                                                           

                                                      • Phase Damping : E^1=[000r]E^0=[1001−r]

                                                        • lossing phase information, energy conserved

                                                      Error Channels

                                                      • Bit Flip : E^1=pXE0=1−pI

                                                      • Phase Flip : E^1=pZE0=1−pI

                                                      • Phase+Bit Flip : E^1=pYE^0=1−pI

                                                      • Depolarizing(Bit/Phase/Bit+Phase Flip) : E^1=p4XE^2=p4YE^3=p4ZE^0=(1−3p4)I

                                                      • if code can correct Pauli X and Pauli Z errors then it can correct all the Pauli operator errors

                                                      Tomography

                                                      • Process tomography : determine the effect of a quantum operation E(ρ^)=∑i,jρi,jE(|i⟩⟨j|)

                                                        • the map E is linear

                                                        • 4 inputs (|1⟩⟨1|,|0⟩⟨0|,|+x⟩⟨+x|,|+y⟩⟨+y|) for 1 qubit, measure output ρ for each input

                                                      • State tomography : determine the state of a quantum system ρ=I+r→⋅σ→2

                                                        • 3 measurement for 1 qubit

                                                        • d2−1 (4n−1?) measure for n-qubit state

                                                       

                                                      Classical Error Correction

                                                      classical coding theory :

                                                      • number of physical bits : n

                                                      • number of logical bits : k

                                                      • minimal bit flip to change the code : d

                                                      • number of errors can be corrected : t=d−12

                                                      Quantum Error Correction

                                                      Fidelity : distance between quantum states

                                                      • two pure states : F(|ψ⟩,|ϕ⟩)=|⟨ψ|ϕ⟩|2

                                                      • two mixed state : F(ρ,σ)=σρσ

                                                      • one pure state one mixed state : F(ρ,|ψ⟩)=⟨ψ|ρ|ψ⟩

                                                      3-qubit bit-flip code : (α|0⟩+β|1⟩)⊗|0⟩⊗|0⟩→α|000⟩+β|111⟩

                                                      syndrome extraction

                                                      • no error

                                                        (α|000⟩+β|111⟩)|00⟩→(α|000⟩+β|111⟩)|00⟩

                                                      • one error

                                                        (α|001⟩+β|110⟩)|00⟩→(α|001⟩β|110⟩)|01⟩(α|010⟩+β|101⟩)|00⟩→(α|010⟩β|101⟩)|11⟩(α|100⟩+β|011⟩)|00⟩→(α|100⟩β|011⟩)|10⟩

                                                      3-qubit phase-flip code : (α|0⟩+β|1⟩)⊗|0⟩⊗|0⟩→α|+++⟩+β|−−−⟩

                                                      syndrome extraction

                                                      |+⟩|+⟩→CNOT|+⟩|+⟩|+⟩|−⟩→CNOT|−⟩|−⟩

                                                      • no error

                                                        |+++⟩|++⟩→|+++⟩|++⟩|−−−⟩|++⟩→|−−−⟩|++⟩

                                                      • one error

                                                        |++−⟩|++⟩→|++−⟩|+−⟩|+−+⟩|++⟩→|+−+⟩|−−⟩|−++⟩|++⟩→|−++⟩|−+⟩

                                                      Shor 9-qubit concatenated code : α|0⟩L+β|1⟩L=α(|111⟩+|000⟩)⊗3+β(|111⟩−|000⟩)⊗3

                                                      syndrome

                                                      • Bit errors : Z1Z2,Z2Z3, Z4Z5,Z5Z6, Z7Z8,Z8Z9

                                                      • Phase errors : X1X2X3X4X5X6,X4X5X6X7X8X9

                                                      Knill-Laflamme condition

                                                      different errors lead to orthogonal states, E{a,b} are error operators

                                                      ⟨Φi|Ea†Eb|Φj⟩=Cabδij

                                                      error operators are linearly independent

                                                      ifEa†Eb=IthenCab=σab

                                                      Stabilizer

                                                      applying any of the stabilizer operators to a codeword returns the same codeword

                                                      S|ϕ⟩=|ϕ⟩

                                                      Example : Bell state |Φ+⟩ stabilized by two operators

                                                      • ZZ|Φ+⟩=|Φ+⟩

                                                      • XX|Φ+⟩=|Φ+⟩

                                                      Notation

                                                      • P : pauli group : P={±I,±iI,±σx,±iσx,±σy,±iσy,±σz,±iσz}

                                                        • Pn=P⊗n

                                                        • PnPn′=⨂(Pn,i⋅Pn,i′)

                                                          • A⋅A=IA∈{X,Y,Z}

                                                          • A⋅B=ϵABCiCA,B,C∈{X,Y,Z}

                                                          Example

                                                          XZZXI⋅IXZZX=X(iY)I(−iY)X

                                                        • [Pn,Pn′]=0⇔∀i [Pn,i,Pn,i′]=0

                                                          commute if all element commute

                                                        • [Pn,Pn′]=0⇔∑i1{Pn,i,Pn,i′}=0 mod 2=0

                                                          commute if even number of elements anti commute

                                                        • {Pn,Pn′}=0⇔∑i1{Pn,i,Pn,i′}=0 mod 2=1

                                                          anti commute if odd number of elements anti commute

                                                      • σx,σy,σz : pauli matrices, σx=[0110]σy=[0−ii0]σz=[100−1]

                                                        • [σi,σj]=2iϵijkσk, e.g.[σi,σi]=0[σi,I]=0

                                                        • {σi,σj}=2δij, e.g.{σi,σj}=0i≠j

                                                        • σi2=1

                                                      • [⋅,⋅] : commute [A,B]=AB−BA

                                                        • A,B commute⇔[A,B]=0

                                                      • {⋅,⋅} : anti commute {A,B}=AB+BA

                                                        • A,B anti-commute⇔{A,B}=0

                                                      • ϵijk : Levi-Civita symbol

                                                        • even permutation : ϵ{123,231,312}=1

                                                        • odd permutation : ϵ{213,132,321}=−1

                                                        • two of i,j,k equal : ϵijk=0

                                                      • k : number of element in stabilizer generator

                                                      • n : number of element in the pauli group

                                                       

                                                      Stabilizer group :

                                                      • all elements commute with each other

                                                      • does not contain I⊗n

                                                      Stabilizer generator : minimal set of operators generate all members by multiplication ⟨S1,⋯,Sk⟩→{S1a1⋯Skak}ai∈{0,1}

                                                      Example

                                                      ⟨ZZI,IZZ⟩⏟stabilizer generator→{III,ZZI,ZIZ,IZZ}⏟stabilizer groupk=2n=3

                                                       

                                                      Stabilizer subspace dimension : 2n−k

                                                      • code subspace e.g. |0⟩L

                                                      • orthogonal projector in subspace : PS|0⟩L=|0⟩LPS|1⟩L=|1⟩LPS|ψ⟩=0

                                                      Stabilizer group element : 2k

                                                      Error-Syndrome : [E,Si]=0⇔error not detected (1){E,Si}=0⇔error detected (−1)

                                                      Example : bit flip error (X error) at position 1

                                                      S={XZZXI,IXZZX,XIXZZ,ZXIXZ,ZZXIX}E=XIIII

                                                      result : {1,1,1,−1,−1}

                                                      stabilizer + EC : for [Eb†Ea,Sk]=0⟨j|Eb†EaSk|i⟩=λ

                                                      projector into subspace ：Pj=I⊗n+Sj2 , the eigen value of projected state will only contains {0,1}

                                                      complexity : O(n) stabilizer operators with O(n) Paulis - O(n2) updates per gate

                                                      Gottesman-Knill theorem : A quantum circuit performing

                                                      1. Clifford gates (exception : T-gate, Toffoli gate)

                                                      2. measurement of the Pauli group operators

                                                      3. conditional Clifford group operations

                                                      can be simulated efficiently on a classical computer

                                                      surface code

                                                       

                                                      Hamiltonian Simulation

                                                      k-local Hamiltonian : H=∑i=1mHiHi acting on no more than k qubits

                                                      Example : X−Y model

                                                      H=∑i=1n(JxXiXi+1+JyYiYi+1+JzZiZi+1+hZi)

                                                      2-local hamiltonian

                                                      Solovay-Kitaev theorem ：unitary operator U∈U(2n) which acts non-trivially on k qubits, a universal set of gates S and ε>0, ∃U~∈U(2n) composed of O(logc(1/ε)) gates from S such that ‖U~−U‖<ε with c<4

                                                      • if all Hi commute, e−i∑Hit=∏i=1me−iHit

                                                      Suzuki-Trotter decomposition : eiHt=(eiH1t/KeiH2t/K⋯eiHmt/K)K+O(m2h2t2K)

                                                      • total error :ϵT=mϵLK+O(m2h2t2K)

                                                      • Lie-Trotter decomposition : e(A+B)x=eAeB−12x2[A,B]+O(x3), if [A,B]=0 then ‖ex(A+B)−eAeB‖≤ϵ

                                                      • number of local terms in a k-local n-qubit Hamiltonian : nk

                                                      Notation

                                                      • m : number of terms for Hamiltonian decomposition H=∑i=1mHi

                                                      • h : maximal norm of Hamiltonian term : ‖Hi‖≤h

                                                      • K : Trotter step, Δt=tK

                                                      • ϵT,ϵL : total error, local error for Trotter step
